content.full_text:
Certificate of Survey for Archibald Kincaid, 24 March 18351 Surveyed forArchibald Kincaidthe North West forth of the North East quarter of Section 33 in Township 18 North

of Range 6 West— Begining at the North West corner of the same at a White Oakbearing12 inches in diameter bearing N 85 E 17 Links. White Oak 13 inches S 66 W 58 Links—

Thence S 88 E 20 chains & 21 Links to a White Oak 9 inches S 25 W 27 Links— Thence

South 20 chains to a White Oak 24 inches East side corner— Thence N 88 W 20 chains

& 21 Links to a Spanish Oak 20 inches— corner— Thence North 20 chains to the begining—2
paragraphs: Certificate of Survey for Archibald Kincaid, 24 March 18351 Surveyed forArchibald Kincaidthe North West forth of the North East quarter of Section 33 in Township 18 North
of Range 6 West— Begining at the North West corner of the same at a White Oakbearing12 inches in diameter bearing N 85 E 17 Links. White Oak 13 inches S 66 W 58 Links—
Thence S 88 E 20 chains & 21 Links to a White Oak 9 inches S 25 W 27 Links— Thence
South 20 chains to a White Oak 24 inches East side corner— Thence N 88 W 20 chains
& 21 Links to a Spanish Oak 20 inches— corner— Thence North 20 chains to the begining—2

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote the entirety of the text on page one, including Calhoun’s signature.
2The land described in this survey is located approximately three miles west ofAthensin Menard County.

structured_content.text: Certificate of Survey for Archibald Kincaid, 24 March 18351

Surveyed forArchibald Kincaidthe North West forth of the North East quarter of Section 33 in Township 18 North
               of Range 6 West—  Begining at the North West corner of the same at a White Oakbearing12 inches in diameter bearing N 85  E 17 Links. White Oak 13 inches S 66 W 58 Links—
               Thence S 88 E 20 chains & 21 Links to a White Oak 9 inches S 25 W 27 Links—  Thence
               South 20 chains to a White Oak 24 inches East side corner—  Thence N 88 W 20 chains
               & 21 Links to a Spanish Oak 20 inches— corner— Thence   North 20 chains to the begining—2
